mil4.6:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil4.6:1.1_0: and Saying, “Good,” he consented, lay followers.
mil4.6:1.2_0: “Great king, there are these ten lay followers.
mil4.6:1.3_0: Take a lay follower who undertakes and follows the ten qualities of pleasure and pain, the power of patience and gentleness, and making them decline.
mil4.6:1.4_0: They have right view. They don’t take refuge in the Southern Hills. They don’t guard the sense doors, and they don’t goes for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They’re harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling.
mil4.6:1.5_0: When you see these ten lay followers, you’re found in me. You won’t decline in any kind of lay followers, you only growth, increase, and maturity.
mil4.6:2.1_0: The discussion of the request of Meṇḍaka is finished.
